pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.2: At that time the monks were bathing in the hot springs.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.3: On one occasion King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha wanted to wash his head, and he went to the hot springs.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.4: He waited respectfully for the monks to finish, but they kept on bathing until dark.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.6: In the morning, with his make-up still on, he went to the Master, bowed, and sat down.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.8: The Master said to him, “Great King, why have you come early in the morning with your make-up still on?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.10: The King told him what had happened.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.11: The Master then instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching, after which the King got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Master with his right side toward him, and left.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.13: The Master had the Order of monks assembled and asked them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.14: “Is it true, monks, that monks bathed without moderation, even after seeing the King?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.17: How can those foolish men bathe without moderation, even after seeing the King?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.18: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.19: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.20: ‘If a monk bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.21: In this way the Master laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.1.1: Soon afterwards, because they were afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not bathe when it was hot or when they had a fever, and they went to sleep covered in sweat.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.1.2: As a consequence their robes and the furniture were soiled.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.1.4: “Monks, if it’s hot or you have a fever, I allow you to bathe at intervals of less than a half-month.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.1.5: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.1.6: ‘If a monk bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, unless there is an appropriate reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.1.7: This is the appropriate reason: it is the two-and-a-half-month period of the hot season and the fever season, comprising the last one-and-a-half months of summer and the first month of the rains.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.1.10: In this way the Master laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.1.1: Soon afterwards some monks were sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.1.2: “We hope you’re bearing up; we hope you’re getting better?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.1.4: “Previously we bathed at intervals of less than a half-month, and then we were comfortable.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.1.5: But now that this has been prohibited by the Master, we don’t bathe because we’re afraid of wrongdoing. Because of that we’re not comfortable.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.1.7: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to bathe at intervals of less than a half-month.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.1.8: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.1.9: ‘If a monk bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, unless there is an appropriate reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.1.10: These are the appropriate reasons: it is the two-and-a-half-month period of the hot season and the fever season, comprising the last one-and-a-half months of summer and the first month of the rains; he is sick.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.1.1: In this way the Master laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.1.2: Soon afterwards the monks were doing building work, but because they were afraid of wrongdoing they did not bathe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.1.3: As a consequence they went to sleep covered in sweat, and their robes and the furniture were soiled.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.1.6: “Monks, I allow you to bathe at intervals of less than a half-month when you are working.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.1.7: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.1.8: ‘If a monk bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, unless there is an appropriate reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.1.9: These are the appropriate reasons: it is the two-and-a-half-month period of the hot season and the fever season, comprising the last one-and-a-half months of summer and the first month of the rains; he is sick; he is working.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.1.12: In this way the Master laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.1.1: Soon afterwards the monks were traveling, but because they were afraid of wrongdoing they did not bathe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.1.2: As a consequence they went to sleep covered in sweat, and their robes and the furniture were soiled.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.1.5: “Monks, I allow you to bathe at intervals of less than a half-month when you are traveling.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.1.6: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.1.7: ‘If a monk bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, unless there is an appropriate reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.1.8: These are the appropriate reasons: it is the two-and-a-half-month period of the hot season and the fever season, comprising the last one-and-a-half months of summer and the first month of the rains; he is sick; he is working; he is traveling.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.1.11: In this way the Master laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.1.1: Soon afterwards a number of monks were making robes out in the open, and they were assailed by dusty winds and fine rain.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.1.3: But because they were afraid of wrongdoing, they did not bathe afterwards, and they went to sleep while still moist.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.1.4: As a consequence their robes and the furniture were soiled.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.1.6: “Monks, if there is wind and rain, I allow you to bathe at intervals of less than a half-month.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.1.7: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.1.8: ‘If a monk bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, unless there is an appropriate reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.1.9: These are the appropriate reasons: it is the two-and-a-half-month period of the hot season and the fever season, comprising the last one-and-a-half months of summer and the first month of the rains; he is sick; he is working; he is traveling; there is wind and rain.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a complete Order through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.6: At intervals of less than a half-month:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.9: if he bathes with bath powder or soap, then every effort constitutes wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.10: At the end of the bath, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.11: Unless there is an appropriate reason:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.16: the first month of the rainy season. During the two-and-a-half-month period of the hot season and the fever season, he may bathe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.18: he is not comfortable without bathing. If he is sick, he may bathe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.21: even if he just sweeps the precincts of a building. If he is doing work, he may bathe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.24: if he intends to travel six kilometers, he may bathe; while traveling, he may bathe; after he has traveled, he may bathe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.26: monks are assailed by dusty winds, and two or three drops of rain have fallen on their bodies. If there is wind and rain, they may bathe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.2.1: If it is an interval of less than a half-month, and he perceives it as less, and he bathes, unless there is an appropriate reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.2.2: If it is an interval of less than a half-month, but he is unsure if it is, and he bathes, unless there is an appropriate reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.2.3: If it is an interval of less than a half-month, but he perceives it as more, and he bathes, unless there is an appropriate reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.2.4: If it is an interval of more than a half-month, but he perceives it as less, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.2.5: If it is an interval of more than a half-month, but he is unsure if it is, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.2.6: If it is an interval of more than a half-month, and he perceives it as more, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.3.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.3.3: The seventh rule, the training rule on bathing, is finished.
